headline: Elise's Favorite Waldorf Salad
description: This fruity Waldorf salad combines apples, celery, and pecans with a creamy dressing and a hint of cinnamon.
name: Elise's Favorite Waldorf Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Combine apples, celery, and pecans in a bowl.
Whisk mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, and cinnamon together in a separate bowl until well combined.
Whip heavy cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form; fold into mayonnaise mixture to form a creamy dressing.
Fold apple mixture into the dressing until coated; chill in refrigerator for about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: A really good go-to Waldorf Salad. I substituted the mayo with plain yogurt, decreased the whip cream. Also replaced the sugar with Splenda & Honey. Definitely refrigerate 2 hours prior to serving. The cinnamon was a hit.
I substituted honey instead of white sugar and added arugula to the mixture. Can also add some mixed spring greens if desired. Makes the recipe even healthier.
I made this for thanksgiving and it was so very delicious, I used pecans instead of walnuts. I absolutely love this . Thank you.

This is the first waldorf salad I've made. I followed the recipe as given. I used a little over 3/4's of the dressing and thought it was more than enough. I added another apple, rib of celery and 1/2cup of low sugar craisins for color. Overall I loved the salad. The dressing is creamy

This is amazing. Super decadent, but worth it. 
I didn't have grapes, but I had everything else and cantaloupe -- it was actually a fabulous substitution. I also used pecans (rather than more traditional walnuts) because of my husband's allergies. 
A must-have for picnic lunches!
No changes. We loved it the way recipe was written.

I like this recipe for it's simplicity and refreshing flavours. The whipped cream makes it yummy. Next time I will skip the cinnamon & replace the mayonnaise with something lighter, maybe creme fraiche or light yogurt. I might also replace the lemon juice with pineapple. And I know it won't be Elise's Waldorf Salad.
My mom made it for years but this is my first time...just like hers

This salad is a nice one for Christmas Dinner. I added 1/2 cup of craisins and substituted green grapes for celery, which some people which gave little tang to the salad, and gave a Our family will definitely enjoy this again.
I did not make one change. It is the best Waldorf salad I have ever had!
Excellent recipe. I added grapes and some powdered sugar. My kids LOVED it !!

Loved this! Have tried several different recipes for Waldorf Salad and none measured up as this one. I used 3 different kinds of apples. Granny Smith, Gala & Red Delicious, unpeeled. I also added a Red Pear, Red Grapes, few Marshmallows, Walnuts in place of Pecans. The Whipped Cream added so much to the Dressing! This is going to be a favorite of mine. Thanks for the recipe!
I love the flavor of the dressing with the cinnamon but the ratio of dressing to apples is off, way too much dressing. Easy fix, I just added another apple and it was perfect.
its wonderfull

I omitted the cinammon and changed the dressing to 1/3 Hellman's mayo, 1/3 softened cream cheese, and 1/3 sour cream whipped altogether with just a small amount of Trevia (hubby is diabetic), plus added some canned pineapple bits. No matter how much of this I make, there is never enough for left-overs!
There was way too much dressing for the amount of fruit in this recipe and it was a flop at the function I brought it too. It tasted mostly like mayo. Would not recommend this recipe :(
There was way too much dressing in my opinion for the amount of apples. But my whipping cream didn't want to get firm so that may have been an issue. It was just ok I thought.

I loved how this turned out. I don't care for the mayo in other recipes, but the addition of the whipping cream was perfect! It tones down the mayo taste and the cinnamon adds just a hint of flavor, but doesn't overpower anything. Nice. Thank you for the recipe!
Really delicious. Next time I will *measure* my cinnamon and use less mayo.
We had this for our Thanksgiving meal and it was a hit.

As a nice treat for myself, I had a couple of mixed apples to use and felt this recipe was fitting. I scaled the recipe down to make a 2 serving recipe to share with 2 of my children that would enjoy this as well as me. It was prefect. At 1st, I was not liking the mayo taste but that was before I chilled it in the frig for an hour. After chilling for the amount of time, the mayo flavor disappeared and a hint of cinnamon lingered as well as the flavor of the apples. I thoroughly enjoyed this recipe, all with a side of bacon.
